New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored a game-high 29 points and recorded eight assists, leading the Oklahoma City Thunder to a franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season win
Key Match Events: Jalen Williams hit a runner at the halftime buzzer to cut the Clippers' lead to four and scored the first six points of the second half to start a 23-5 run that put the Thunder in control
Norman Powell, averaging a career-high 24.3 points per game, struggled with his shooting, missing his first nine shots and finishing with six points on 1-of-11 shooting
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder's depth ultimately overwhelmed the Clippers, who were without James Harden due to a late scratch
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder, now 28-5 on the season, have won 17 of their last 18 regular-season games
The Thunder continue their homestand Friday night against the Knicks, while the Clippers return home to host Atlanta on Saturday with the expected return of Kawhi Leonard
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder added to their league-leading steal total with 11 takeaways during the game
Others: The game was played on January 3, 2025
